article:
'Lee' or 'Li' or 'ly' are English transliterations of '××', a Hebrew name
meaning "for me" or "to me". When used as a given name, Lee is a term of
endearment. [http://judaism.about.com/od/hebrewname1/tp/names_gl.htm Â©2011
About.com. All rights reserved.]

"Lee" may used in conjunction with other words to form a more elaborate name
with a more specific meaning. It can be added as a prefix or a suffix. Examples:
*Adding as a suffix to "Shir" ( ×©××¨ ) will form "Shirly" which means "a song for
me". *Adding as a suffix to "Or" ( ×××¨ ) will form "Orly" which means "a light
for me" and is usually feminine. *Adding as a prefix to "Or" will form "Lior"
which also means "a light for me", but is not gender-specific.
